Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Metchnikowin (Mtk-1, natural AMPs; Pro-rich; PrAMPs; UCLL1, insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: Rich in Proline.Host expression:induced: This peptide is induced via the TOLL pathway.Activity: Active against M. luteus (MIC 0.5-1 uM), and N. crassa (MIC 0.5-1.0 uM). It showed significant (P < 0.001) inhibitory activity against the blood-stage P. falciparum parasite (Tonk et al. 2019).Plant protection:Barley: Transgenic plants: Insect peptide metchnikowin confers on barley a selective capacity for resistance to fungal ascomycetes pathogens (J Exp Bot. 2009;60(14):4105-14).Updated 4/2017; 5/2019.
Literature Information.Author: Levashina EA, Ohresser S, Bulet P, Reichhart J-M, Hetru C, Hoffmann JA.1995
Literature Information.Title: Metchnikowin, a novel immune-inducible proline-rich peptide from Drosophila with antibacterial and antifungal properties.
